product_overview: The Renault Pending System is a Next.js-based logistics management platform tailored for Renault automotive service centers. It streamlines inventory tracking, customer booking, and order workflows with a premium dark-themed interface featuring Renault Yellow accents, providing sub-100ms UI responsiveness and optimistic updates.
core_goals: Centralize all pending parts tracking in one system with real-time visibility
Automate routine operations and status updates across order lifecycles
Enable efficient customer communication and appointment scheduling
Ensure data consistency, audit trails, and 24/7 system availability
Minimize user training time with intuitive UI and optimize performance for large datasets
key_features: Comprehensive Order Management API to create, update, and retrieve orders with validation and unique tracking IDs
Dynamic Main Sheet inventory tracking with status lifecycle management and bulk operations
Customer Communication Call List with queue management, call status tracking, and notes attachment
Premium Booking System featuring a dark-themed calendar with multi-VIN grouping and two-year booking history
Archive subsystem maintaining immutable audit trails with reorder capabilities and 48-hour retention
Responsive Notification System with detailed metadata and bulk management
Advanced Cross-tab Search and Discovery across multiple data points with direct source navigation
Configurable Settings for part status definitions, appearance customization, and history management
Optimistic UI updates leveraging TanStack Query for instant feedback and sub-100ms perceived latency
Performance optimization via set-based lookups, index-based updates, lazy loading, and debounced operations
user_flow_summary: Users submit or import orders via the Order Management interface, with automated validation and assignment of tracking IDs.
Orders flow through the Main Sheet where parts lifecycle statuses are updated; bulk operations and locking mechanisms prevent errors.
Completed parts move automatically to the Call List where customer contacts are managed and communications logged.
Booking coordinators schedule appointments in a premium calendar interface supporting multi-VIN entries and pre-booking notes.
Archived orders and bookings are retained, supporting compliance with immutable records and easy reorder functionality.
Users receive real-time notifications with detailed info and can search across all modules with filters and direct navigation.
Settings allow administrators to manage part statuses, UI appearance, and history retention policies.
validation_criteria: Orders can be created, updated, and retrieved correctly via API with proper validation and unique tracking IDs.
Status updates in Main Sheet reflect immediately with optimistic UI and bulk operations execute without errors.
Customer call logs and booking appointments are tracked, stored, and retrievable with consistent data integrity.
The booking calendar displays correctly with visual indicators and maintains historical data for at least two years.
Notifications appear responsively with accurate metadata, and users can manage notifications individually and in bulk.
Cross-tab search yields relevant results with seamless navigation to source data rows across modules.
The UI maintains sub-100ms perceived latency with optimistic updates and no data loss after batch operations.
48-hour history retention and auto-cleaning features function correctly without performance degradation.
The embedded security model ensures no backend dependency, with full TypeScript type safety and minimal PII exposure.
Testing covers unit, E2E, and performance benchmarks validating all core workflows and cross-browser compatibility.
